title: Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek loses battle to keep 6ft-high decking put up without permission
text:
The England and Chelsea midfielder, Ruben Loftus-Cheek, has lost a battle with neighbours to keep a 6ft garden decking put up without planning permission.

The Premier League star had the three-storey structure built at his £1.7million house in Cobham, Surrey in 2016.

The Chelsea midfielder (pictured) had the three-storey structure built at his £1.7million house in Cobham, Surrey in 2016

However, neighbours complained they had lost privacy in their homes because they were overlooked.

Others claimed that the 23-year-old played loud, X-rated drill music from his garden.

'We have certainly lost the earlier privacy of our garden. The decking also seems to accommodate speakers which face directly towards our garden, and during summer months we are regularly forced to scream over the fence to get the volume turned down,' a neighbour complained.

The footballer put in a retrospective planning application.

However, after a three-year battle, Elmbridge Borough Council have refused it.

Loftus-Cheek is now set to be ordered to take it down.

Under the plans submitted to his local council by his mum Juilette, the decking has a width of 6.1m and is constructed in three levels which are varied in depth between 2.4m and 3.3m.

The footballer put in a retrospective planning application. However, after a three-year battle, Elmbridge District Council have refused it. Loftus-Cheek is now set to be ordered to rip it down. (Oak Road in Cobham Surrey, where Loftus-Cheek has received complaints from neighbours)

It includes also has a steel rope handrail and has steps in between each level.

In a decision notice, Kim Tagliarini, head of planning services, ruled: 'The decking due to its height and siting, has resulted in loss of privacy and overlooking. Which is harmful to the amenities of the occupiers of this neighbouring property.'

An Elmbridge Borough Council spokesman said: 'The matter is currently with our Planning Compliance team, who will be considering if any formal enforcement action is required.'

In 2016, an outbuilding next to his mansion, (pictured above) was hit by lightning during a storm - the third time he'd had a near miss from a bolt

Loftus-Cheek faced another property battle two years ago as he rowed with residents over an extension on his five-bedroom home close to Chelsea's training ground.

A neighbour had complained that his planned two-storey garage extension would allow direct views into their garden and devalue the property.

In 2016, an outbuilding next to his mansion was hit by lightning during a storm - the third time he'd had a near miss from a bolt.
description: Ruben Loftus-Cheek had the three-storey structure built in 2016 at his £1.7million house in Cobham, Surrey. Neighbours complained about a loss of privacy.
